intro: Hieracium leptophyllum, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium leptophyllum is often found in rocky or gravelly areas and is adapted to cold, harsh environments.
